alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins; Lyon; McLean; Muhlenberg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 11:47PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Muhlenberg, northern Christian, Caldwell, southeastern McLean, Hopkins and northern Lyon Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from Earlington to Dawson Springs to near Eddyville. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Madisonville, Princeton, Dawson Springs, Earlington, Nortonville, and Mortons Gap around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Graham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 36 and 45. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 68 and 120. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 56. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 23 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Christian; Hopkins; Lyon; McLean; Muhlenberg
